item.title: Rune Factory: Guardians of Azuma version 1.1.0 update now available
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • Switch
  • Switch 2

New boss gauntlets, development zone, and more.

Marvelous has released the version  1.1.0 update for Rune Factory: Guardians of Azuma, which adds four “extremely difficult” boss gauntlets that can be challenged after completing the main quest, a new development zone, capacity and level increases, and more.

Here are the full patch notes:

Version 1.1.0 Update Patch Notes

  • Adventuring
    • Added four extremely difficult boss gauntlets which you can challenge after completing the main quest “Guardians of Azuma.”
  • Village Life
    • Added a new development zone to Summer Village which you can access after reaching Village Level 8.
    • Upon reaching Village Level 10, the maximum number of facilities you can place has increased by 5, and the maximum number of decorations you can place is now 256 across the board.
    • Expanded the Storage Box capacity from 810 to 1,200.
    • Expanded the Seeds & Such capacity from 300 to 400.
    • Tsubame’s Early Bird Boutique will now sell Chocolate after you reach a certain Village Level.
    • Added sorting functionality to the VillageBuilding menus, forging menus at blacksmiths, and building menus at carpenters.
  • Socializing
    • Increased the maximum Bond Level to 100.
    • You will earn various recipes and items at certain Bond Levels for each character.
  • Bug Fixes
    • Fixed a bug where villagers tasked with farming would sometimes harvest crops even when the action was set to Off.
    • Fixed bugs related to some NPC conversations during festivals and contests.
    • Additional minor bug fixes.

Rune Factory: Guardians of Azuma is available now for Switch 2, Switch, and PC via Steam.



https://www.gematsu.com/2025/10/rune-factory-guardians-of-azuma-version-1-1-0-update-now-available

item.title: MIGHTREYA delayed to first half of 2026
item.content:encoded:
• PC

No longer due out in 2025.

Publisher 505 Games and developer Wazen have delayed anime-style hero action adventure game MIGHTREYA from its previously planned 2025 release window to the first half of 2026. It will be available for PC via Steam.

Here is the full message from Wazen on the delay:

Thank you for your continued support of MIGHTREYA.

Originally scheduled for release in 2025, we have decided to shift the launch to 2026.

I’m not struggling with direction—the problem is that there’s just an overwhelming amount to build. We are making every effort to ensure a release in the first half of 2026.

Development will continue toward a full release, and we’ll be sharing updates and new information along the way.

We truly appreciate your patience and support, and we hope you’ll look forward to what’s coming next.



https://www.gematsu.com/2025/10/mightreya-delayed-to-first-half-of-2026
